info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 5:55PM CDT until May 26 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
FFWSJT
The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Kimble County in west central Texas... Mason County in west central Texas...
* Until 900 PM CDT.
* At 553 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area across northern Kimble county across all of Mason county...moving southeast at 20 mph. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Junction, Mason, London, Yates Crossing, Katemcy, Hedwigs Hill, Hilda, Art, Loyal Valley, Pontotoc, Roosevelt, Koockville, Cleo and Us-87 Near The Mason-Gillespie County Line.
This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 434 and 459.
This includes the following Low Water Crossings... RM 2291 crossings along Bear Creek, Hurley crossing, Old Katemcy Mason crossing Comanche Creek, Oak Grove crossing, Old Union crossing San Fernando Creek, Behrens School crossing Comanche Creek, Spy Rock crossing, Vater crossing Hasse Creek, Old Pontotoc crossing Little Willow Creek and Flatrock Ln. crossing South Llano River.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 9:00 PM CDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 9:00 PM CDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 9:00 PM CDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 9:00 PM CDT. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
